verses.text: 所羅門禱告完了，有火從天上降下來，燒盡了燔祭和其他的祭品；耶和華的榮光充滿了那殿。

words.note: Refers to the physical sky, but also heaven spiritually.

verses.text: 因為耶和華的榮光充滿了耶和華的殿，祭司都不能進入耶和華的殿。
那火降下，耶和華的榮光停在殿上的時候，以色列眾人都看見；於是他們在鋪石地跪下，俯伏在地，敬拜稱頌耶和華說：「耶和華是良善的，他的慈愛永遠長存。」

words.note: Refers to a specific type of ground in the temple area.
Often refers to an act of worship or submission.
Often used in religious contexts to praise God.
Emphasizes moral goodness and benevolence.
A key biblical term for God's steadfast love.
Often used for eternal qualities of God.

verses.text: 王和全體人民都在耶和華面前獻祭。
所羅門王獻上了二萬二千頭牛、十二萬隻羊為祭。這樣，王和全體人民為 神的殿舉行了奉獻禮。

words.note: Reverence mark often precedes '神' (God) in Chinese Bibles.
Specifically refers to a rite of dedicating something sacred.

verses.text: 祭司都站在自己的崗位上；利未人也站著，拿著大衛王所做的耶和華的樂器，稱頌耶和華，因為他的慈愛永遠長存；大衛藉著他們讚美耶和華的時候，祭司在眾人前面吹號；以色列眾人都站著。

words.note: One who manages sacrifices
Indicates the object of the verb or emphasizes the action.
Frequently used in the Bible for God's steadfast love.
Often used in Psalms for God's enduring qualities.

verses.text: 所羅門把耶和華殿前院子當中的地方分別為聖，在那裡獻上了燔祭和平安祭的脂肪，因為所羅門所做的銅壇容不下所有的燔祭、素祭和脂肪。

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.
A verb with a negative potential complement.

verses.text: 那時，所羅門和全體以色列人，就是來自哈馬口，直到埃及小河的一群極大的會眾，一起舉行了七天的節期。

words.note: Refers to the Wadi of Egypt (Brook of Egypt).

verses.text: 第八天舉行了嚴肅會，又舉行獻壇禮七天，舉行了七天的節期。
七月二十三日，王遣散眾民回家；他們因看見耶和華向大衛、所羅門和他的子民以色列所施的恩惠，心裡都歡喜快樂。
這樣，所羅門完成了耶和華的殿宇和王宮。在耶和華的殿裡或所羅門的宮中，所羅門心裡要作的，都順利地作成了。

words.note: Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Book of 1 Kings)

words.definition: to want to, be about to

verses.heading: The Lord Gives Solomon a Promise and a Warning

verses.text: 夜間，耶和華向所羅門顯現，對他說：「我已經聽了你的禱告，也為我自己選擇了這地方作獻祭的殿。
如果我使天閉塞不下雨，或吩咐蝗蟲吞吃這地的土產，或差遣瘟疫到我的子民中間來；

words.note: Refers to blocking the heavens, preventing rain.

verses.text: 這稱為我名下的子民，若是謙卑、禱告、尋求我的面，轉離他們的惡行，我必從天上垂聽，赦免他們的罪，醫治他們的地。

words.note: Figuratively means belonging to or identified with.
Refers to seeking God's face/presence.
Literally 'to listen downwards', implying a superior listening to an inferior.

verses.text: 現在我的眼睛必張開，我的耳朵必垂聽在這地所發的禱告。

words.note: Literally 'to listen downwards', implying a superior listening to an inferior.
Indicates the following verb acts upon the preceding noun phrase.

verses.text: 現在我揀選了這殿，把它分別為聖，使我的名永遠在這殿中；我的眼和我的心也常常留在那裡。

words.note: Often refers to divine selection.
Lit. 'separate to be holy'.
In Bible, often refers to God's character/authority.
Used here as a locative suffix with '在'.

verses.text: 至於你，你若是在我面前行事為人像你的父親大衛所行的那樣，遵行我吩咐你的一切話，謹守我的律例和典章，

words.note: Describes one's moral conduct.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb.
To respectfully follow instructions or laws.
Implies careful and faithful observance.
Refers to established rules and decrees.

verses.text: 我就必鞏固你的國位，好像我和你父親大衛所立的約說：『你的子孫必不會斷人作君王統治以色列。』

words.note: Lit. 'national position', referring to a king's throne.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb.

words.definition: cut off succession, lack a successor
words.note: Refers to ending the line of kings; lit. 'break people'.

verses.text: 「可是，如果你們轉離我，丟棄我在你們面前頒布的律例和誡命，去事奉和敬拜別的神，

words.note: Often implies spiritual turning away.
Implies devoted service, often religious.

verses.text: 我就必把以色列人從我賜給他們的土地上拔出來，並且我為自己的名分別為聖的這殿，我也必從我面前捨棄，使這殿在萬民中成為笑談和譏笑的對象。

words.note: Implies a superior giving to an inferior.
Used here as a locative suffix with '從...上'.
A directional verb compound.
In Bible, often refers to God's character/authority.
Lit. 'separate to be holy'.
Used here as a locative suffix with '在'.
Can be a noun (ridicule) or verb (to ridicule). Here as noun.

verses.text: 這殿雖然高大，但將來經過的人，都必驚訝，說：『耶和華為甚麼這樣對待這地和這殿呢？』

words.note: Refers to a specific religious building.

verses.text: 人必回答說：『是因為這地的人離棄了耶和華他們列祖的 神，就是領他們從埃及地出來的 神，去親近別的神，敬拜和事奉他們；所以，耶和華使這一切災禍臨到他們。』」

words.note: Refers to the specific God of Israel.
Refers to the specific God of Israel.

words.definition: draw near to, be intimate with

words.note: Refers to false gods.
